When I start with gunicorn, the debugging code and execution results are as follows:

can you solve?

At the very first run, OAP needs to wait for OAP init job to finish, while the init job needs to wait for the storage's readiness. 

What do you mean it's slow? Do you measure from the OAP is running or from the OAP is created?

This is a great idea to reduce the load on the storage side! I think we can start with the minute dimensionality, it's the most frequent. And for the hour/day dimensionality it's difficult to estimate the expiration time of the cache.
Our axios test is like this, https://github.com/apache/skywalking-nodejs/blob/master/tests/plugins/axios/server.ts

@zshrine let's track the issue here

If you want to propose that, you want to do something, go ahead. 
This is not a kind of requirement, the project maintainers would do.
This is duplicate of https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/9814 and I think @fgksgf is already working on this

Let's see how @fgksgf would do. I think we need more work after this mechanism is ready.
Is there an ETA for review?

> Let's see how @fgksgf would do. I think we need more work after this mechanism is ready.
> Is there an ETA for review?

Before https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/10051 this issue is a "nice to have" enhancement so we don't set an ETA, but if it impacts the metrics in https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/10051, we could prioritize this.
#10051 doesn't rely on this as a hard requirement. Alerting enhancement requires this more.

I think #9814  is not exactly the same. #9814 is trying to fix the delay between the  OAP fetched `RemoteClients` and the real instance status.  But this issue wants to resolve the other OAP module services doesn't know the `RemoteClients` is changed.
I finally referred to the solution of # 7457, specified post_fork in gunicorn, and encountered a similar # 7457 problem.

> I think #9814  is not exactly the same. #9814 is trying to fix the delay between the  OAP fetched `RemoteClients` and the real instance status.  But this issue wants to resolve the other OAP module services doesn't know the `RemoteClients` is changed.

If you read carefully they are exactly the same essentially. 9814 is to make the coordinator module know remote clients are changed. This can be shared to other modules and let them know the remote clients changed too.
FYI @apache/skywalking-committers If any of you feel interests, you could follow this thread.

MAL core semantics are a variant of PromQL, so we have some experience with PromQL. I want to discuss the scope of PromQL to OAP:

  * Do we tend to use PromQL as an alternative to GraphQL-based APIs? Beside Topology and Trace querying, PromQL might be in place of most scenarios. But we can extend PromQL to support them if we want to go "all-in" PromQL. 
  * Do we replace MAL and LAL with PromQL since they derive from the latter?
  * Furthermore, will OAL get involved?

I can't see the point to do the replacement, because that would impact the whole query.
Also, SkyWalking would keep in pre-calculation as recommended. The main point of this is exposing the aggregated query in another channel, nothing more.
So, MAL, OAL, GraphQL APIs are kept for good reasons.

The current multiple dimensions query would be the fundamental query to provide time-series data, this would not even impact the storage level. The whole PromeQL implementation is on top of GraphQL. @hanahmily

@fgksgf @wankai123 @kezhenxu94 Please ref to https://github.com/apache/skywalking/pull/10083, when we build a notification callback mechanism, especially for cluster status, we could build this callback in the core module through new **ServerStatusService**.
Just contacted @fgksgf and he thinks he has very limited time to work on this so I'm closing this in favor of https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/10076
If I follow what you are asking, do you mean other modules should react based on the telemetry module's data? That is not correct from my understanding.

> If I follow what you are asking, do you mean other modules should react based on the telemetry module's data? That is not correct from my understanding.

I don't mean that. Let's say in another way, if you insist we should add the new service in core module, I hope finally we can rewrite the telemetry module to reuse the server status logics in core module, that should make sense right?

> I don't mean that. Let's say in another way, if you insist we should add the new service in core module, I hope finally we can rewrite the telemetry module to reuse the server status logics in core module, that should make sense right?

I am afraid I can't from tech perspective. The Telemetry is the leaf of the module dependencies. That is why I am adding a layer in the core as a delegation. 

https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/18008aa6b24ada6602d9c73e1a9d19b6105d8b59/oap-server/server-core/src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/oap/server/core/CoreModuleProvider.java#L401-L407
Hi @wu-sheng , this will be my first contribution and i am interested to look into this issue..can you assign this issue to me?

@sumanpal97 Done. Please prepare your proposal of API design, before write any codes.
This task would take some time.

No, we are not breaking protocol.
All float number should be calculated on the visualization part. Keep the data accurate.
If you want to query backend oriented avg, the method has been provided.

> The only small problem now is that the Long type value returned by this interface is not accurate enough.

That doesn't make sense. The precision relies on MAL, has nothing related to float or long.

There is nothing changed due to this proposal. You will still need to query segments by trace ID.
And you referred a years ago issue, it doesn't mean anything for the current codes.
Why do you post an issue but only with a INFO log?
Sorry, I'll rewrite it

@mrproliu I don't know why, But it seems ebpf network profiling fails as process relationship e2e check fails.
But I can't follow why my change affects that.

```
- 		map[interface{}]interface{}{
 - 			string("detectpoints"):     []interface{}{string("CLIENT")},
 - 			string("id"):               string("a6998b690466d1d80fa9379dafd9145d6a6d8b45ab49949c9405ddecd169960d-b456c20e471dc1ca4dfa06529b6e3cf320916c49bd12dcd847de8856ab321fd3"),
 - 			string("source"):           string("a6998b690466d1d80fa9379dafd9145d6a6d8b45ab49949c9405ddecd169960d"),
 - 			string("sourcecomponents"): []interface{}{string("tcp")},
 - 			string("target"):           string("b456c20e471dc1ca4dfa06529b6e3cf320916c49bd12dcd847de8856ab321fd3"),
 - 			string("targetcomponents"): []interface{}{},
 - 		},
 + 		map[interface{}]interface{}{
 + 			string("detectpoints"):     []interface{}{string("CLIENT"), string("SERVER")},
 + 			string("id"):               string("a6998b690466d1d80fa9379dafd9145d6a6d8b45ab49949c9405ddecd169960d-e68bf4959a6e1d10f6d9032662f1187f0325[445](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/actions/runs/3620492727/jobs/6104321005#step:7:452)a348bd5708a4f87e71420d3bb"),
 + 			string("source"):           string("a6998b690466d1d80fa9379dafd9145d6a6d8b45ab49949c9405ddecd169960d"),
 + 			string("sourcecomponents"): []interface{}{string("http")},
 + 			string("target"):           string("e68bf4959a6e1d10f6d9032662f1187f0325445a348bd5708a4f87e71420d3bb"),
 + 			string("targetcomponents"): []interface{}{string("http")},
```

It seems this relationship query logic is not correct. You never put the component ID in the ID.
Because I remove metrics persistent offsite,  there is no guarantee there is TCP or HTTP component ID in the relationship. I think you should either 
1. Support component IDs as a list, and support update when new component ID is added
2. Put the component ID in the ID.
Got it. I will fix this PR.
@mikechengwei Do you still work on this?
We only accept English on GitHub.

Clear the UI_TEMPLATE index. Notice, we never mentioned upgrading is transparent
This is not a bug.
I hope #10111 provides the final fix for unexpected metrics expired. There were some metrics reloaded from the database(before #10111)

> That doesn't make sense. The precision relies on MAL, has nothing related to float or long.

If the precision is completely controlled by MAL/OAL, then it is more appropriate to display the integer milliseconds of the latency (response time) on the UI, because the unit of latency itself is milliseconds and `readMetricsValue` returns a Long type value, so the decimal place has no value when displaying in milliseconds.
Or latency increases the multiple when aggregated like sla and apdex to ensure the accuracy of average calculation, and finally divides by the multiple when visualizing.

sla and apdex is multiplied by 10000 when aggregated
https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/d6fa688ff8022c766cfaf3681c3b5f9113fc877f/oap-server/server-core/src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/oap/server/core/analysis/metrics/PercentMetrics.java#L64-L66

https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/d6fa688ff8022c766cfaf3681c3b5f9113fc877f/oap-server/server-core/src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/oap/server/core/analysis/metrics/ApdexMetrics.java#L92-L94

And then divided by 100 and 10000 when [visualizing](https://github.com/apache/skywalking-booster-ui/blob/1f98619a5b4ddbac4ac990dc5465b9b59bfa3349/src/hooks/useMetricsProcessor.ts#L473-L487)
```ts
case Calculations.PercentageAvg:
  data = (val / 100).toFixed(2);
  break;
case Calculations.Apdex:
  data = (val / 10000).toFixed(2);
  break;
```

The latency is collected and calculated in milliseconds of Long type, and displayed in milliseconds with two decimal places. Although there is no problem with the data, it feels a bit strange that a data without decimal places always displays these two decimal places.
https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/d6fa688ff8022c766cfaf3681c3b5f9113fc877f/oap-server/server-starter/src/main/resources/oal/core.oal#L20
https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/d6fa688ff8022c766cfaf3681c3b5f9113fc877f/oap-server/server-core/src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/oap/server/core/analysis/metrics/LongAvgMetrics.java#L64-L66

From the previous description, it seems that this should be regarded as a visualization problem. However, if an API like `readMetricsValue` that calculates the average value can directly return a Float type value instead of rounding the average value, then the precision control can be more free.
https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/f1c7e939831d6a2286c0f3108cddb9241898ec1a/oap-server/server-storage-plugin/storage-elasticsearch-plugin/src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/oap/server/storage/plugin/elasticsearch/query/MetricsQueryEsDAO.java#L95-L98
`((Number) agg.get("value")).longValue()` will round the floating-point average value.

The simple answer is, ms for response time is reasonable for application service.
Don't use this to measure a method execution. I don't think a RPC latency in 0.5 or 1 ms makes any different from an APM perspective.

I probably know what you mean. Refer to the following configuration. Add apm-trace-ignore-plugin.config in your agent dir.

```yml
trace.ignore_path=${SW_AGENT_TRACE_IGNORE_PATH:*/health}
```

@kezhenxu94 Considering we have a certain index `refresh_period`, do you think it is reasonable to shorten the time of BulkProcess' flushInterval? It is 15s for now, plus the persistent period(25s), the worth case is 25s + 15s + 30s(refresh_interval) to make the data visible.

Of course, this only happens in a small dataset. We could keep the current setting for now.

> @kezhenxu94 Considering we have a certain index `refresh_period`, do you think it is reasonable to shorten the time of BulkProcess' flushInterval? It is 15s for now, plus the persistent period(25s), the worth case is 25s + 15s + 30s(refresh_interval) to make the data visible.
> 
> Of course, this only happens in a small dataset. We could keep the current setting for now.

Sounds good to me

All these tags are available to check on span page, you can check on your own too.

The server's flags will set physical options instead of APIs.
The server's flags will set physical options instead of APIs.

Although the latency is reduced to ms when data is written in buffer(Main memory). The querying takes seconds when scanning tables on the disk. 
![profile005](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1960537/206616779-83d2ceef-588f-4048-9470-71e70ea5effb.png)

There are a couple of enhancements needed to be applied. The order represents their priorities. 

- [ ] [OAP] Using `or` in place of several independent short `querying by service_id/instance_id/endpoint_id`. `or` could merge `source` and `dest` searchings.
- [ ] Reclaim the write buffer of the inverted index. 
- [ ] Remove the primary index to get rid of scanning tables.
